title: ‘Frightening’ serial sex predator targeting young women in seaside attacks
text:
Police have released images of a man they believe has been sexually assaulting women (Picture: Sussex Police)

Police have released new images of a man they believe to be a serial sex attacker after an escalating pattern of assaults.

Three woman have so far been attacked in Brighton, with each case sharing similar traits, involving the attacker attempting to engage his victims in conversation before sexually assaulting them.

He kissed one of his victims on the lips.

Officers hope the newly released CCTV images could help identify the suspect, described as being in his late 30s with black Afro-style hair.

The most recent attack happened on 7 October at around 5.30am in Marine Parade, Brighton.

The 19-year-old victim resisted the man’s assault and ran off after struggling to get free.

One image shows the suspect walking away immediately after the attack.

This picture was captured from the area immediately after the attack (Picture: Sussex Police)

Two days earlier, at around 6.25 am on 5 October, an 18-year-old woman was sitting on a bench outside All Bar One in the city centre when she was grabbed and kissed.

Shaken but unhurt she also managed to push the attacker away and run off.

An image published by police shows the suspect walking near to the Pavilion Buildings in the city immediately before the attack.

The first report comes from 24 July at about 1.35am when a third woman, 22, was sexually assaulted while walking in Ditchling Road, Brighton.

She managed to resist the attacker and he fled towards London Road before he disappeared.

The suspect is described as being black or mixed race, about six feet tall and of slim to medium build. In the first attack he was said to be wearing square-rimmed glasses while in the second he wore a black tracksuit with stripes down the arms.

He is said to be in his 30s-40s and spoke in broken English.

The man police wish to speak with walking near the Pavilion Gardens before the attack (Picture: Sussex Police)

Detective Inspector Duncan Elliott, heading Operation Downgate, said: ‘These were very frightening experiences for the women, who have been receiving support and assistance from specialist officers.

‘We have issued these two images in the hope someone may recognise or identify the man in either of the images and will be able to assist with the ongoing intensive investigation which began in July.’

description: 'Frightening' serial sex predator wanted after three attacks in seaside town of Brighton
